definition:
The number $$\begin{aligned}
\zeta(3) &= \sum_{n=1}^\infty\frac{1}{n^3} \\
         &= 1.202056903159594285399738161511449990764986292\ldots\end{aligned}$$
has been called Apéry’s constant since 1979, when Roger Apéry published
a remarkable proof that it is irrational [@cite:apery_irr].
